result.execSummary:
The defendant James R. Kaufman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Set up a payment plan today before leaving.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James R. Kaufman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James R. Kaufman in court with attorney Shari L Post. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:34 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  Count 2 - GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Post makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court .
Court questions the defendant. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 2 - 
Pay fine of $300 plus costs including the DNA Surcharge. 
To set up a payment plan today before leaving. 

Defendant indicates he has a current payment plan. 
Court advises he still needs to see the Clerk today.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 10, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Defendant James R. Kaufman in court with attorney Shari L Post. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:51 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:
Pre-Trial to commence today and Pre-Trial information to be filed 
Bond Continued.

Defendant James R. Kaufman in court with attorney Shari L Post. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:23 p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 


BY THE COURT:
Bond and conditions of bond continued  Arraignment scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 08:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 22, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
$2,000 sig bond: Comply with all other outstanding conditions of bond and probation.  Not to be on the premises of Kohls store while case is pending.

Defendant James R. Kaufman in court with attorney Shari L Post. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.
$  cash bond:  Not to be on the premises of Kohls store while case is pending.
Atty Post requests sig bond and the defendant is doing counseling and treatment and employment and has been very co-operative.
BTC: $2,000 sig bond: Comply with all other outstanding conditions of bond and probation.  Not to be on the premises of Kohls store while case is pending.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
